en: Is it next to impossible to live to be 150?

en: It is said that Friday the 13th is an unlucky day.
zh: 据说13号星期五是不吉利的日子。

en: A few days after his thirteenth birthday, Tony left school, too.
zh: 托尼在十三岁生日后的几天也离开了学校。

en: When she was thirteen, she ran away from home.
zh: 她十三岁的时候，离家出走了。

en: As is often the case with 13 to 19 year olds, she fell in love.
zh: 正如13到19岁的青少年经常发生的情况一样，她恋爱了。

en: Some people say thirteen is an unlucky number.
zh: 有些人说十三是一个不吉利的数字。

en: Are there enough chairs to seat 12 people?
zh: 有足够的椅子让12个人坐下吗？

en: Twelve musicians constitute the society.
zh: 十二位音乐家组成了这个社团。

en: How about 12:45?

en: I shall never forget your kindness no matter where I may go.
zh: 无论我去哪里，我都永远不会忘记你的善良。

en: I could swim across the river when I was twelve.
zh: 我十二岁的时候就能游过这条河。

en: Twelve years is old for a dog.
zh: 十二岁对狗来说已经老了。

en: Many boys and girls ranging from 12 to 18 entered the contest.
zh: 许多12到18岁的男孩和女孩参加了比赛。

en: His voice broke when he was twelve.
zh: 他十二岁的时候变声了。

en: Don't you think it is rather warm for December?

en: Twelve is an even number.
zh: 十二是一个偶数。

en: The sum of 12, 24, 7 and 11 is 54.
Has Flight 123 arrived?
zh: 123次航班到了吗？

en: Has Flight 123 been delayed?
zh: 123次航班延误了吗？

en: You want the Number 11. It stops in front of the post office.
zh: 你要乘坐11路车。它在邮局前停靠。

en: It's almost half past eleven.
zh: 现在快十一点半了。

en: It is a little after a quarter to eleven.
zh: 现在刚过差一刻十一点。

en: It is close to eleven. It's about time we went to bed.
zh: 快十一点了。我们该睡觉了。

en: In 11 hours, we will arrive in San Francisco around 7:30.
zh: 11个小时后，我们将在大约7点30分到达旧金山。

en: After 11 o'clock the guests began to leave by twos and threes.
zh: 十一点过后，客人们开始三三两两地离开了。

en: You can go out, as long as you promise to be back by 11 o'clock.
zh: 你可以出去，只要你答应十一点前回来。

en: I barely managed to finish the letter by eleven o'clock.
zh: 我勉强在十一点前完成了这封信。

en: I'm catching the 11:00 train.
zh: 我要赶11点的火车。

en: I go to bed at eleven.
zh: 我十一点睡觉。

en: Come and see me at eleven o'clock.
zh: 十一点来找我。

en: It's already eleven. It's high time you were in bed.
zh: 已经十一点了。你早该睡觉了。

en: Eleven o'clock is good for me.
zh: 十一点对我来说可以。

en: We'll be home at about 11:00.
zh: 我们大约11点到家。

en: Be at the station at eleven on the dot.
zh: 准时十一点在车站等候。

en: I want to catch the 11:45.
zh: 我想赶11点45分的那班车。

en: It is ten minutes before eleven.
zh: 现在是差十分十一点。

en: It gets cold day by day in November.
zh: 十一月天气一天比一天冷。

en: I would like to attend the party on November 1st.
zh: 我想参加11月1日的聚会。

en: The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.
zh: 第11页的地图看起来很奇怪。把它倒过来。然后它就变成你熟悉的地图了。

en: Please refer to page ten.
zh: 请参考第十页。

en: After ten minutes' walk we came to the museum.
zh: 走了十分钟后，我们来到了博物馆。

en: Ten minutes' walk brought me to the station.
zh: 走了十分钟，我到了车站。

en: Ten minutes' walk brought us to the bus stop.
zh: 走了十分钟，我们到了公共汽车站。

en: Someone called on you ten minutes ago.
zh: 十分钟前有人来拜访过你。

en: She left home ten minutes ago.
zh: 她十分钟前离开家了。

en: After ten minutes, they passed on to a new topic.
zh: 十分钟后，他们转移到了一个新的话题。

en: Let's take a 10 minute break.
zh: 我们休息十分钟吧。

en: After a ten-minute break, we resumed our rehearsal.
zh: 休息十分钟后，我们继续排练。

en: Let's have a ten-minute break.
zh: 我们休息十分钟吧。

en: I had not waited ten minutes before Mary came.
zh: 我还没等十分钟，玛丽就来了。

en: He'll be along in ten minutes.
zh: 他十分钟后就到。

en: You'll get there in less than ten minutes.
zh: 你不到十分钟就能到达那里。

en: I'll be back in ten minutes.
zh: 我十分钟后回来。

en: I arrived at the station ten minutes late.
zh: 我晚了十分钟到达车站。

en: Ten years ago the ward office gave us ballpoint pens on the Coming of Age Day.
zh: 十年前，区公所在成人节那天送给我们圆珠笔。

en: Kyowa Bank and Saitama Bank merged into Asahi Bank ten years ago.
zh: 协和银行和埼玉银行十年前合并为朝日银行。

en: There was a deep pond there ten years ago.
zh: 十年前那里有一个深池塘。

en: Ten years ago his theory would not have been generally accepted.
zh: 十年前他的理论不会被普遍接受。

en: Ten years ago, such business would have been a success.
zh: 十年前，这样的生意会很成功。

en: There used to be a small bridge over the river 10 years ago.
zh: 十年前，河上有一座小桥。

en: This is the worst storm in ten years.
zh: 这是十年来最严重的风暴。

en: He saw his home-town again only after ten years.
zh: 他十年后才再次见到他的家乡。

en: In ten years our town will change a lot.
zh: 十年后，我们的城镇会发生很大的变化。

en: Suppose there was a worldwide oil shortage in ten years' time. What would happen to the industrialised countries?
zh: 假设十年后全球石油短缺。工业化国家会发生什么？

en: I hope I'll have learned a great deal about it in ten years.
zh: 我希望十年后我已经学到了很多关于它的知识。

en: I left Japan for the first time in ten years.
zh: 我十年来第一次离开日本。

en: He returned home for the first time in ten years.
zh: 他十年后第一次回到家。

en: Ten years is a long time.
zh: 十年是很长的时间。

en: Ten years is a short time when we look back at it.
zh: 当我们回顾过去时，十年是很短的时间。

en: Ten years have gone by.
zh: 十年过去了。

en: Ten days passed by.
zh: 十天过去了。

en: It rained for the first time in ten days.
zh: 十天来第一次下雨。

en: There were ten accidents in as many days.
zh: 在短短几天内发生了十起事故。

en: The teenage friends stayed up talking all night.
zh: 这些十几岁的孩子们熬夜聊天。

en: During my early teens, I was not always on the best of terms with my parents.
zh: 在我十几岁的时候，我和父母的关系并不总是很好。

en: Teenagers must adapt to today's harsh realities.
zh: 青少年必须适应当今严酷的现实。

en: Do you have a tatami room for ten people?
zh: 你们有能容纳十个人的榻榻米房间吗？

en: Three out of ten persons have a video.
zh: 十分之三的人有录像机。

en: It can accommodate as many as ten people.
zh: 它最多可以容纳十个人。

en: As many as ten people saw the accident.
zh: 多达十个人目击了这起事故。

en: As many as ten people live in this small house.
zh: 这间小房子里住了多达十个人。

en: As many as ten students stood up all at once.
zh: 多达十名学生同时站了起来。

en: As many as ten students failed the exam.
zh: 多达十名学生考试不及格。

en: Ten prisoners broke out of jail.
zh: 十名囚犯越狱了。

en: Ten policemen were assigned to patrol that area.
zh: 十名警察被派去巡逻那个区域。

en: I'm going to take the 10:30 train.
zh: 我打算乘坐十点半的火车。

en: You must be back before ten.
zh: 你必须在十点之前回来。

en: We must leave the hotel before 10 a.m., otherwise we will miss the train for Miami.
zh: 我们必须在上午10点之前离开酒店，否则我们将错过前往迈阿密的火车。

en: The fog began to disappear around ten o'clock.
zh: 雾大约在十点钟开始消散。

en: Don't call me up after ten o'clock.
zh: 十点以后不要给我打电话。

en: Breakfast will not be served after ten o'clock.
zh: 早餐十点以后停止供应。

en: I'll come by 10.
zh: 我十点左右过去。

en: See that dinner is ready by ten.
zh: 务必在十点前准备好晚餐。

en: On condition you are back by ten o'clock, you may go to the dance.
zh: 如果你能在十点之前回来，你就可以去参加舞会。

en: You must be back by 10 o'clock.
zh: 你必须在十点前回​​来。

en: I'll stay here until ten.
zh: 我会待在这里到十点。

en: He leaves Osaka for Tokyo at ten.
zh: 他十点离开大阪去东京。

en: I'll be back at ten.
zh: 我十点回来。

en: I have a previous engagement at ten.
zh: 我十点有约了。

en: Come at ten o'clock sharp.
zh: 请在十点整准时来。

en: We got through the work just before ten.
zh: 我们在十点前完成了工作。

en: It's ten o'clock sharp.
zh: 现在是十点整。

en: It's open ten to six daily throughout the year.
zh: 全年每天早上十点到下午六点开放。

en: We have a break from 10:40 to 11:00.
zh: 我们从十点四十分休息到十一点。

en: It is twenty minutes past ten.
zh: 现在是十点二十分。

en: He is very clever for a boy of ten.
zh: 他作为一个十岁的男孩非常聪明。

en: I had not seen a lion before I was ten years old.
zh: 我十岁之前没见过狮子。

en: Ten houses were burned down.
zh: 十栋房子被烧毁了。

en: Please refer to paragraph ten.
zh: 请参考第十段。

en: Only five instead of ten units were delivered.
zh: 只交付了五个单位，而不是十个。

en: The fire burnt ten houses down.
zh: 大火烧毁了十栋房子。

en: One day in October, when Sadako awoke, she found her mother crying.
zh: 十月的某一天，佐佐木祯子醒来时，发现她的母亲在哭泣。

en: There was a suggestion that the general meeting should take place in October.
zh: 有人建议全体大会应该在十月举行。

en: We have a lot of very fine days in October.
zh: 我们在十月有很多美好的日子。

en: Indian summers run into October.
zh: 小阳春会延续到十月。

en: It's the third of October.
zh: 今天是十月三号。

en: Read Lesson 10 from the beginning.
zh: 从头开始阅读第十课。

en: Let's start with Lesson Ten.
zh: 让我们从第十课开始。

en: One billion people speak English.
zh: 有十亿人说英语。

en: I bought five ten-yen stamps.
zh: 我买了五张十日元的邮票。

en: Can I make a phone call for ten yen?
zh: 我可以花十日元打个电话吗？

en: Ten miles is not a short distance.
zh: 十英里可不是一段短距离。

en: Look at the notes on page 10.

en: Let's begin with the fifth line on page 10.
zh: 让我们从第10页的第五行开始。

en: Give me five tens and the rest in ones.

en: In ten-dollar bills, please.

en: Ten teams competed for the prize.

en: Ten dimes are equal to one dollar.
zh: 十个一角等于一美元。

en: After an absence of ten months, he returned home.
zh: 离开十个月后，他回到了家。

zh: 十减二等于八。

en: Two from ten leaves eight.
zh: 十减二等于八。

en: Count from 10 down to zero.

en: Where is Room 105?
zh: 105房间在哪里？

en: Call the operator at 104 then.
zh: 那就打104找接线员。

en: I have a fever of 102 degrees.
zh: 我发烧102度。

en: There's many a slip between the cup and the lip.
zh: 杯到嘴边还有失手时。(比喻事情在未完成之前，总可能发生变化。)

en: Supposing you had one million yen, what would you do with it?
zh: 假设你有一百万日元，你会怎么做？

en: If you won a million yen, what would you do?
zh: 如果你赢得了一百万日元，你会怎么做？

en: I don't know how things were a hundred or fifty years ago.
zh: 我不知道一百或五十年前的事情是怎样的。

en: There were almost 100 people, few of whom I had seen before.
zh: 差不多有一百人，其中我以前见过的人很少。

en: Few people live to be one hundred years old.
zh: 很少有人能活到一百岁。

en: He can run 100 meters within twelve seconds.
zh: 他能在十二秒内跑完一百米。

en: Could you give me change out of a hundred-dollar bill?
zh: 你能帮我把一百美元的钞票换开吗？

en: Debit Mr Hill with $100.
zh: 借记希尔先生100美元。

en: One hundred dollars is just chicken feed.

en: I'm wondering how long $100 will carry me.
zh: 我想知道100美元能让我撑多久。

en: One hundred dollars will cover all your expenses for the trip.
zh: 一百美元可以支付你这次旅行的所有费用。

zh: 有了100美元，我就能应付了。

en: One hundred cents makes one dollar.
zh: 一百美分等于一美元。

en: More than 1000 issues are listed on the stock exchange.

en: No less than 1,000 people came to the party.
zh: 来参加聚会的人不少于1000人。

en: Could you break a 1,000 yen note?

en: Is one thousand yen enough?
zh: 一千日元够吗？

en: You can buy it for a thousand yen or so.
zh: 你可以花一千日元左右买到它。

en: A thousand dollars is a large sum.
zh: 一千美元是一大笔钱。

en: One thousand dollars will cover all the expenses for the party.
zh: 一千美元可以支付聚会的所有费用。

en: Suppose you had a thousand dollars, what would you do with it?
zh: 假设你有一千美元，你会用它做什么？

en: One, three, and five are odd numbers.
zh: 一、三和五是奇数。

en: It is hard to master it in a year or two.
zh: 在一两年内掌握它很难。

en: A thousand yen will do.
zh: 一千日元就够了。

en: Please move to the rear of the bus.
zh: 请往车厢后部移动。

en: Move along now.
zh: 往前走。

en: No Trespassing.
zh: 禁止通行。

en: "Watch out for the trap!" she screamed.
zh: “小心陷阱！”她尖叫道。

en: Can you make the deadline?
zh: 你能赶上截止日期吗？

en: "Is the essay ready?" "No, I'm sorry. I haven't finished writing it yet."
zh: “文章准备好了吗？”“没有，对不起。我还没写完。”

en: "I'd rather get the sack than not join the labour union," said the disgruntled worker.
zh: “我宁愿被解雇，也不愿不加入工会，”心怀不满的工人说。

en: You could see the elation in the president's face when he announced that our shares are going to be listed on the First Section of the TSE next year.
zh: 你可以看到总统脸上的喜悦，当他宣布我们的股票明年将在东京证券交易所主板上市时。

en: Come, Jesus replied.
zh: 来吧，耶稣回答。

en: "Will you study after dinner?" "Yes, I will."
zh: “你晚饭后会学习吗？”“是的，我会的。”

en: Write an essay on "Friendship".
zh: 写一篇关于“友谊”的文章。

en: "Animals in the wild are not robots," she says.
zh: “野外的动物不是机器人，”她说。

en: "Come back!" he shouted.
zh: “回来！”他喊道。

en: "Shut up," he whispered.
zh: “闭嘴，”他低声说。

en: "Will it rain tomorrow?" "I hope not."
zh: “明天会下雨吗？”“我希望不会。”

en: "Will you play the piano tomorrow?" "No, I won't."
zh: “你明天会弹钢琴吗？”“不，我不会。”

en: Yesterday the teacher said to us, "I'll give you a test tomorrow."
zh: 昨天老师对我们说：“我明天要给你们考试。”

en: "This brand is very mild," Dad said.
zh: “这个牌子很温和，”爸爸说。

en: I want beef, too.
zh: 我也想要牛肉。

en: "Are you sure you want to call the police?" I asked her.
zh: “你确定要报警吗？”我问她。

en: "I'm not good at swimming." "Neither am I."
zh: “我不擅长游泳。”“我也不擅长。”

en: "I'm just thinking about my wish," replied the little black rabbit.
zh: “我只是在想我的愿望，”小黑兔回答。

en: "My father doesn't drink." "Neither does my father."
zh: “我父亲不喝酒。”“我父亲也不喝。”

en: "This is my first flight. I'm nervous," says Hiroshi.
zh: “这是我的第一次飞行。我很紧张，”宏说。

en: What do you mean by cultural relativism?
zh: 你说的文化相对主义是什么意思？

en: "I've a touch of a cold." "That's too bad."
zh: “我有点感冒。”“真糟糕。”

en: "My husband passed on two years ago," an elderly lady said.
zh: “我丈夫两年前去世了，”一位老妇人说。

en: This is what he said: "I shall return by all means."
zh: 他是这么说的：“我一定会回来的。”

en: The words 'beautiful' and 'ugly' are relative terms.
zh: “美丽”和“丑陋”是相对的词语。

en: "The accused" is a legal term.
zh: “被告”是一个法律术语。

en: Mary received an award for her composition called "Secret love".
zh: 玛丽因她的作文《秘密的爱》而获奖。

en: "Are you tired?" "No, not at all."
zh: “你累了吗？”“不，一点也不累。”

en: "Is she reading a book?" "Yes, she is."
zh: “她在看书吗？”“是的，她在看。”

en: "Is she young?" "Yes, she is."
zh: “她年轻吗？”“是的，她年轻。”

en: "Did she buy a watch?" "Yes, she bought one."
zh: “她买手表了吗？”“是的，她买了一块。”

en: "Does she have a dog?" "No, she doesn't."
zh: “她有狗吗？”“不，她没有。”

en: "How old is she?" "She is twelve years old."
zh: “她多大了？”“她十二岁。”

en: "She doesn't like music." "Nor do I."
zh: “她不喜欢音乐。”“我也不喜欢。”

en: "She likes music, doesn't she?" "So she does."
zh: “她喜欢音乐，不是吗？”“确实如此。”

zh: “她真漂亮！”本自言自语道。

en: "Does she play tennis?" "Yes, she does."

en: "She is lovely." "So she is."
zh: “她很可爱。”“确实如此。”

zh: “她的魅力简直无法形容！”艺术家惊叹道。

en: "They left for New York, didn't they?" "Exactly."
zh: “他们去纽约了，不是吗？”“没错。”

en: "Did they get the law passed?" "Yes, they finally put it through."
zh: “他们通过了那项法律吗？”“是的，他们最终通过了。”

en: He denied knowing anything about their plans.
zh: 他否认知道他们计划的任何事情。

en: "Do you think he will come?" "I hope not."
zh: “你认为他会来吗？”“我希望他不要来。”

en: "Is he going to swim tomorrow?" "Yes, he is."

en: "Who is he?" "He is Jim."
zh: “他是谁？”“他是吉姆。”

en: "Is he right?" "I don't think so."

en: "Will he succeed?" "I fear not."
zh: “他会成功吗？”“恐怕不会。”

en: First, in order to get a feel for your favourite author's work, transcribe and copy in full.
zh: 首先，为了感受你最喜欢的作者的作品，完整地抄写和复制。

en: I'd like to hear about black magic. I was only told the highlights in the academy, and it interests me.

en: I suppose that depends on how good you are. I'm counting on you!

en: The downclimb here is also dangerous as there are no handholds.
zh: 这里的下攀也很危险，因为没有扶手。

en: Smiling cheerfully, the two began to walk off into their brilliant future.
zh: 两人笑容满面，开始走向他们光辉的未来。

en: He's a plain speaker.
zh: 他说话很直率。

en: The museum's eastern gallery was closed for cleaning.
zh: 博物馆的东侧画廊因清洁而关闭。

en: The spirit of the treaty was ignored.

en: I thought I could settle it by phone.

zh: 总统敦促员工发挥他们的主动性。

en: We three sisters opened a coffee shop.
zh: 我们三姐妹开了一家咖啡店。

en: Pac-Man, when a certain condition is reached, can counter attack and eat the monsters chasing him.
zh: 吃豆人，当达到特定条件时，可以反击并吃掉追逐他的怪物。

en: It's only the anti-war pinkos who say things like Saddam isn't a threat.
zh: 只有反战的左派才会说萨达姆不是威胁这样的话。

zh: 啊哈哈哈！真是个大错误！

en: Mum said the same thing. But, so what? It's got nothing to do with me.
zh: 妈妈也这么说。但是，那又怎样？这与我无关。

en: Thank you for reading to the end.
zh: 感谢您阅读到最后。

en: I felt very light on my feet afterwards.
zh: 之后我感觉脚步非常轻盈。

en: That was when I was in the first year at high school, so 17 years have passed since then.
zh: 那是我上高一的时候，所以从那时起已经过去了17年。

en: She's a plain speaker.
zh: 她说话很直率。

en: This is my brother. Handsome, isn't he?
zh: 这是我的弟弟。很帅吧？

en: Once you enter a company, you have to work for the company, whether you want to or not.
zh: 一旦你进入一家公司，无论你是否愿意，你都必须为公司工作。

en: The pauper was begging for a living.
zh: 这个穷人在乞讨为生。

en: My boss took me to task for the poor quality of my work.
zh: 我的老板因为我工作质量差而批评了我。

en: This is a highly recommended restaurant.
zh: 这是一家强烈推荐的餐厅。

en: It has become common practise to employ foreigners working abroad from Asian countries as maids.
zh: 雇用来自亚洲国家的外国人在国外当女佣已经成为一种常见的做法。

en: There's a lot of greenery in Tokyo Midtown!
zh: 东京中城有很多绿地！

en: The man I thought was the criminal didn't have any connection to the incident.
zh: 我以为是罪犯的那个人与这起事件没有任何关联。

en: However men, seeking the contents of that safe, kidnap Hana. And those men were really detectives.
zh: 然而，为了寻找保险箱里的东西，那些人绑架了花。而那些人实际上是侦探。

en: The siren sounded an emergency.
zh: 警报声预示着紧急情况。

en: Is it any of your business what someone's hobby is?
zh: 别人的爱好是什么，关你什么事？

en: Mummy, that man just fell flat on his face!

zh: 研究生Ken去年去了美国。

en: People who don't have a computer can't make full use of this MP3 player function.
zh: 没有电脑的人无法充分利用这个MP3播放器的功能。

en: Please don't draw the curtains when the window is open.
zh: 窗户打开时请不要拉窗帘。

en: I held a wedding ceremony last month.
zh: 我上个月举行了婚礼。

en: I myself have, before becoming employed by this company, twice spoken bluntly to the people at the top.
zh: 我自己，在被这家公司雇用之前，曾两次直言不讳地对高层人士说过话。

en: "Gang Wives" is a Yakuza movie released in 1986 by Toei Distribution Network.
zh: 《极道之妻》是东映发行网于1986年发行的一部黑帮电影。

en: In Japan the ring shaped ones came into use first so they're also often called "contraceptive rings".
zh: 在日本，环形的避孕环首先开始使用，所以它们也经常被称为“避孕环”。

en: It's being manipulated by investors trying to make it rich.
zh: 它正被试图发财的投资者操纵。

en: Week 13: Learn about absolute, and relative, motion.
zh: 第13周：学习绝对运动和相对运动。

en: This is centrifugal force; Newton viewed it as absolute motion.
zh: 这是离心力；牛顿将其视为绝对运动。

en: This is centrifugal force, which Newton viewed as absolute motion.
zh: 这是离心力，牛顿将其视为绝对运动。

en: It was April 1905 when a school was built on the site of the theatre.
zh: 1905年4月，在这家剧院的旧址上建起了一所学校。

en: I agree on an emotional level, but on the pragmatic level I disagree.
zh: 在情感层面上我同意，但在务实层面上我不同意。

en: For my tastes, I'd prefer plainer, or rather, more tasteful clothing.
zh: 就我的品味而言，我更喜欢朴素的，或者更确切地说，更有品味的服装。
